description: From Middle French dénuder, from Latin dēnūdāre, from dē- + nūdus (“bare”).

verbs.description: denude (third-person singular simple present denudes, present participle denuding, simple past and past participle denuded)

entries.meaning: To divest of all covering; to make bare or naked; to strip.
examples: He denuded himself of his clothes.
Widespread deforestation has led to lands being denuded.
